comment: Divisor of Fermat number (special form of Lucas' result, see ~ fmtnofac2 ): Let F_n be a Fermat number. Let p be a prime divisor of F_n. Then p is in the form: k*2^(n+2)+1 where k is a positive integer. (Contributed by AV, 26-Jul-2021.)
